arguments.name: Pmt
arguments.description: The payment made each period; it cannot change over the life of the annuity. Typically, pmt contains principal and interest but no other fees or taxes.

arguments.name: Pv
arguments.description: The present value, or the lump-sum amount that a series of future payments is worth right now.

arguments.name: Fv
arguments.description: The future value, or a cash balance you want to attain after the last payment is made. If fv is omitted, it is assumed to be 0 (the future value of a loan, for example, is 0).

arguments.name: Type
arguments.description: The number 0 or 1 and indicates when payments are due.
